PartyContainers

Class Player

  • java.lang.Object
    • PartyContainers.Player
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    AI, HumanPlayer

    public abstract class Player
extends java.lang.Object
    Player is an abstract class that will be extended by HumanPlayer and AI player. It serves as a wrapped that will hold a participating entities inventory and party of heros. To adhere to encapsulation the Heros composing the party and the Items composing the inventory will manage all Heros / Items / Inventory / Party actions. This class is just to store these Maps. Why abstract? 1) We don't know the party composition yet, the AI and the Human player have access to different Classes 2) Having just one class Player for both AI and Human would make it more difficult to determine where control is handled during battle
    Author:
    Kevin

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Player()
      Empty super constructor that will just fill the inventory.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Player

        public Player()
        Empty super constructor that will just fill the inventory. As mentioned in the class description the abstract method makeDefaultParty will be defined in both AI and HumanPlayer to use classes specific to their controller.

    • Method Detail

      • makeDefaultParty

        public abstract void makeDefaultParty()
        Abstract method to be overridden once we know which classes are avialable to compose a party with.

      • getParty

        public java.util.TreeMap<java.lang.String,Hero> getParty()
        Returns the TreeMap of the Player's party. Organized in ascending order by the speed of each class of hero.
        Returns:
        TreeMap of Player's party

      • getCharacter

        public Hero getCharacter(java.lang.String name)
        Returns a hero from the party based on their class name.
        Parameters:
        Name: - The class name of the hero you wish to get
        Returns:
        Hero: the hero you wish to access.

      • inventoryItems

        public java.util.ArrayList<Item> inventoryItems()
        Returns a new ArrayList with copies of each item's address of the current Player's inventory. Used for ease of iteration in GridGUI VS going over each Map.Entry.
        Returns:
        A new ArrayList with shared references to this players inventory items.

      • getInventory

        public java.util.TreeMap<java.lang.String,Item> getInventory()
        A method that returns the TreeMap of the current Player's inventory.
        Returns:
        A Shallow copy of this Player's Inventory TreeMap
